column1: short of a length with some late movement away outside off, rising up to waist height as Latham takes it
just wide of square leg as he pulls this early. It's short of a length and closer to the off stump this time, moving away again. He gets the hands through early and ends up dragging it aerially
short of a length, shape away outside off. Defended off the back foot. Only after being squared up a touch
short of a length and angled into the corridor. Arches backwards to leave this
good length and late swing away from off stump after going wide of the crease. Roy plants the front leg forward to defend with the full face. Williamson misfields with a slide to his right at mid-off
good length and just outside off. Left alone. Neat carry through to the keeper
good length and shaped into the batsman who stands tall and defends with the full face
inside edge beats fine leg to his right. Ugly slap on the up from Roy as this shapes in late from outside off. Angled bat, away from the body. Gets the result he was after
short of a length on middle stump, nudged to midwicket on the up
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot

short of a length and slanted across off stump. Stands tall and punches nicely through the line to get it wide of mid-off. Williamson chases but can't parry this back in at the boundary after getting there
full on leg stump, watchfully tapped to short midwicket
full and slanted down leg side. Can't get bat on the flick
nicely timed. Good length on leg stump and he leans in and closes the face at the right time to nudge this through midwicket
full on off stump, stands put in the crease and lifts this through the line, over the non-striker. Through it early and it ends up dragging it a touch, but safe enough in the end
length outside off, draws him on the front foot and gets him to deflect this off the inside half
good length outside off, a bit of wobble. Looks to drive away from the body and gets an inside edge onto pad
full and a bit of wobble again. Anxiously pushed back down the pitch with the front leg out of the way
back of a length on off stump, tapped to point off the back foot
superb timing again. Boult goes full with the inswinger but Roy's stride is good. He pushes it between square leg and midwicket
good length and in the corridor. Dead-batted into the off side
length on the pads, nudged on the up to midwicket
full and just outside off, drilled straight to mid-off on the up
short of a length just outside off, mistimed drive on the rise into the covers
gets this through cover. Santner appears to have dived over it as Bairstow uses the angle across him to free his arms and punch this on the up
appeal for lbw but that's going over. And there's an inside edge. Roy walks at Southee and gets one that's angled in. Tucked up as he looks to flick
handsome. Roy dispatches this through wide mid-off like he's having a knock against under-arm bowling in the nets. Full balance, through the line outside off on the front foot
short and wide outside off, slapped fiercely to third man's right
full on off stump, driven back at the bowler
short of a length on the pads. Thuds into the thigh guard as he looks to flick
length and in at off stump. Driven uppishly towards mid-on. There's bounce in this pitch

New Zealand have had a horror start in the field. Length ball outside off ends up to Latham's left off the inside edge. He shies at the non-striker's end where Bairstow is well in. No one's backing up and Williamson gives chase from mid-off. For the second time, he gets there but fails to drag it in after putting in the slide
tonks him in the box and it's a collective 'ooooh' from the crowd. Roy walking down the pitch again. It's short of a length again and he misses as he tries to drive through midwicket
good length on off stump, testing his mid-riff's mobility. Roy fully forward to defend solidly

over square leg. Superb from Roy. Seemed to climb with the ball that was dug in short. The hands were coming from underneath and adjusted well. He used his wrists late to place it too, all while holding his shape
full on middle stump, tapped past the bowler
length outside off, looks to drive through the covers and gets an inside edge
overpitched on leg stump, whipped to deep square leg's left
offcutter, back of a length and climbing up at off stump. Defended watchfully
full on middle stump, clipped straight to short midwicket
offcutter is poorly disguised on this occasion and Roy brings out a clean swing to clear the long-off boundary. It's lobbed up full and it's picked early
length on off stump, defended to mid-off on the front foot
good length on middle stump, punched on the up to long-on

a review for lbw now. Roy trapped on the back foot, Latham says it's pad first. Looks high on first look and appears to have pitched outside leg as well...Latham's right about the contact. It is pad first. But tracking confirms out suspicion. That's pitching outside leg. The original not-out decision stands.
good length on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
full and wide outside off. Chases to try and slice this. Beaten
short of a length and slanted wide outside off. Shapes to cut, leaves
oh top skill. Roy is in it. Arches into the leg side and lifts this short ball over Latham, as casually as possible. That was climbing up at his chest
full and swung down leg this time. He can't get bat on the flic
short and wide outside off. Reaches out for the cut and under-cuts it into the turf. Bairstow says no to the single
good length and in the corridor. Pushed to extra cover on the up
short and wide outside off. Gets in line, slashes between point and short third man
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
good length on leg stump, tickled to deep square with the angle
good length and down leg side. No bat on the attempted flick
full on leg stump, punched on the up to long-on

evades mid-off with the aerial punch. Length outside off and he was perhaps looking to go over mid-off. Long extension of the hands in front of the body and it dips in front of mid-off, but it's well to his right
tossed up on leg stump, met on the full and drilled to long-on
glorious shot inside-out. This is full on middle stump, he gets the front leg out of the way and lifts it cleanly over extra cover
back of a length and pushed through at middle stump. Dropped in front of midwicket with soft hands
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
turn. And some bounce. Short of a length and lifting away outside off. Roy looks to bludgeon it off the back foot with an angled bat and is beaten
good length on off stump, driven on the up to long-off with the turn
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

well taken! Santner leaps forward and scoops one up at short fine. Roy will wait around, but that's a clean catch. He looks to pull and is early on it. It's a top-edge as the ball spins towards the off side. It hangs in front of the fielder who has picked it late, but adjusts superbly to get his hands under it with a forward pounce
floated up at a length on off stump. Defended on the front foot
tossed up outside off, driven straight to cover
good length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length just outside off. Pushed to extra cover off the back foot
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
struck on the pad as this slides under his attempted flick. It's going down
outside edge after he's drawn forward. This drifts, dips and turns. No slip now. Short third man pulls it back in
back of a length at off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot
full on off stump, driven to extra cover on the bounce
floated up at off stump, finds extra cover with the drive again
full outside off, mistimed drive on the front foot, straight to cover
tossed up on middle stump, driven to long-on
googly, on a length just outside off. Plants the front leg forward and defends close to the body
full on off stump, driven to long-off with the turn
googly not picked. Dipping outside off and Root is looking to drive through cover on the up. Gets an inside edge to short fine
length on off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
length outside off, nudged to point's right for a quick single. Taylor swoops down on it but can't pick up
full outside off, can't beat extra cover with a drive to his right

manages to get it wide of extra cover after stepping out and getting beaten in flight. He wasn't close to this at all as it landed outside off. Threw his hands at it hurriedly in the end and managed to slice it wide of mid-off
length outside off, poked to extra cover off the front foot
back of a length on middle stump, pushed towards long-on off the back foot
tossed up wide outside off, reaches out to drive to cover, who's on the edge of the 30-yard circle.

shortish on middle and leg - not that short, actually, but Root drags his back foot deep inside his crease, gets down on one knee, and places his pull-sweep perfectly in the gap at deep backward square leg
floated up outside off this time, sweeps hard and flat to deep square leg
tossed up on off stump, driven to short extra-cover
googly, pitches it too short and he goes back to punch to sweeper cover. That man was on the edge of the circle for Root, he's gone back for Bairstow. Not sure who's come in in his stead
slow flight close to off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
top-edged sweep, but it doesn't carry. Was too early into the shot, the ball was dangled up slow on leg stump, and it ballooned up to the right of short fine leg, but bounced well short of him
full on middle and leg, driven to long-on
speared in flat, sliding down leg. Gets down quickly and sweeps flat, over the head of the square-leg umpire
tossed up on off stump, driven inside-out to long-off
flat length ball on middle stump, gets on the front foot and dabs with soft hands into the point region, with the turn
flighted and full outside off, driven to long-off

bang. That's a nicely flighted, good-length legbreak on off stump, and he just clears his front leg and hoicks it waaaay over long-on. 97m, Craig Cumming reckons in the comm-box. 107m, according to the official measure.
wrong'un, pitching on a good length outside off. Bairstow presses forward and shows the full face to pick up a single to long-off and bring up a lovely, fluent fifty
flatter, quicker legbreak close to off stump, pushed into the covers and can't quite find the placement for the quick single. A rare dot ball
Oh my, nearly drags it on. It was perhaps not short enough to pull, and there's some slow turn that means he has to drag it from well outside off. Bottom edge, and then into front leg
tossed up wider and fuller, driven to sweeper cover
flat, quick and fairly full on off stump, defended to short extra
full outside off, opens his bat face slightly to push to sweeper cover
nice length this time. Presses forward for another push into the covers but it drops on him slightly and then carries on with the arm, inside-edges into the leg side
nicely bowled. This one is quicker, on a similar length to the previous ball, outside off. Doesn't quite get fully forward for the dab into the covers, and the ball turns past his outside edge
fullish, gets forward to block
shortish outside off, chopped into the point region
tossed up outside off, Root plays a checked drive to cover
well bowled. Slower and wider than the previous one, and drops onto a slightly shorter length before turning away. Root drives away from his body, only manages an outside edge to short third man
another shortish one that stops on Root. Looks to pull, drags it into the leg side off the bottom edge
tossed up outside off, slowed down nicely, Bairstow presses forward and defends into the covers

and another. Picks the wrong'un nice and early, picks it up on an off-stump line, clearing his front leg and swinging smoothly through the line to thump another big six over long-on. This one's a little straighter than the previous one, and clocks 95m.
full outside off, defended into the point region
full on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length, angling into the pads, tucked to the left of short fine leg
back of a length on off and middle, and this one stays a little low as he goes on the back foot. Punched down to long-off safely enough

ooh, well bowled. Wasn't quite close enough to the pitch of this flat one as he came forward to defend. Went at it with hard hands and nearly offered up a return catch. Fell just short of the bowler, who threw the ball up in a mock celebration to confuse everyone further
length ball on off stump, looks to defend into the off side but it goes straight on with the arm and rolls into the on side off the inner half of the bat
whoa, this man is in sensational hitting form. Again, right in his slot, on off stump, and he swings it away high over long-on
back of a length, angling into the stumps, tucked away through square leg
back of a length on middle stump, worked away to deep square leg
back of a length again, straightens towards off stump, goes on the back foot to turn it wristily to midwicket
back of a length again, on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
full on middle stump, clipped to long-on
short, angling into leg stump. Skids on as Root shapes to pull, and he can't get as much power on it as he'd like, rolls down to short fine leg for a single
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
nice length on middle and off, defended to short extra-cover
angles this one down leg, and Bairstow gets a big stride in to sweep it hard to the left of short fine leg
length ball on off stump, gets forward to defend into the off side
back of a length on off stump, makes himself room for the late chop to backward point
flat length ball on off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover

not quite a long-hop, but Munro's only gentle medium, and Root doesn't even go on the back foot to pull this, just swivels from the waist and beats the man diving to his right at deep square leg. Got his fingertips to it but couldn't prevent the boundary
back of a length on middle and leg, looks to flick, only manages an inside edge onto pad
back of a length on off stump. Makes a bit of room and lets it come on for the gentle dab to short third man
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length, this one nips back in off the pitch to cramp Root as he shapes for the back-foot punch. Ends up checking his shot and picking up a quiet single into the cover point region
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover

fullish, angling into off stump, and Santner drops a straightforward catch at extra-cover. Drives hard and early, and it goes at just around shoulder height, pretty much straight to the fielder, but he jumps awkwardly and grabs at it without letting it come to him
a bit wider now, sliced to third man off the outside half of the bat. Wanted to drive through cover point, I think
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point

short ball angling across the batsman. Gets up to shoulder height and it's through him quicker than expected as he misses the pull. Appeal for caught behind, not given. Replays show it clipped the side of his helmet
another short one angling across - this one's a bit wider. Again Bairstow misses a pull
full inswinger, misses the flick and it hits his pad but that was swerving down the leg side easily
length ball angling into off stump, shows the full face to drive to long-on
back of a length on middle and leg, tucks it gently between deep midwicket and deep backward square leg. A slip at  the bowler's end while turning prevents the second run
length ball on middle stump, driven to long-on

shortish on off stump, and that's lovely from Bairstow, makes a lot of roo, and plays a late cut, rolling his wrists over at the top of the bounce, to get it into the gap between backward point and short third man

fullish slower one, looked like the knuckleball, and Bairstow slugs it back down the ground, towards the bowler, hard and at ankle height. Bursts through his hands and rolls to mid-off. Tough chance, but it'll count as a drop nonetheless
length ball outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
shortish on middle and leg, pulled to long leg
back of a length, angling into the body. Gets back and across to tuck it off his hip to long leg
yorker outside off stump. Jams down a touch late on it and can't make contact
back of a length, slanting across the batsman. Looks to make room and play the cute dab to third man, can't make contact
shortish again, stops on the pitch slightly as he looks to go back and across and work it into the leg side. Ends up hitting him on the body
length ball on off stump. Looks for the checked drive and Southee throws himself to his left at cover and cuts it off
back of a length on leg stump, worked away through square leg

length ball angling in from wide of the crease. Shapes to play the inside-out drive, but it doesn't really come on - may have been another knuckleball - and he turns his wrists to play it to midwicket instead
smack. Drops just a touch short and that's enough for Root to swat him away over the square-leg boundary
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, jabbed back to the bowler
fuller now, on off and middle, punched back to the bowler
tossed up slow on middle and off, defended towards backward point
shot! This one he spears in quicker, on a length on off stump, and Root is in position so quickly for the reverse-ramp, over the right shoulder of the keeper
back of a length on off stump, punched to extra-cover
shortish, close to off stump, punched to backward point
back of a length on off stump, pushed to backward point with an open face
length ball on off stump, punched back to the bowler. Hung in the air briefly but bounced just short of him
full outside off. Too full for the big heave over mid-on, ends up dragging it along the ground to the right of the bowler, who dives to his right and parries it to midwicket
Munro dives right again, but can't prevent a single down to long-on. Nice straight-bat push off the length ball on off and middle
Shot@! back of a length, angling into middle stump, and he just makes himself room and lets the ball hit his adroitly angled bat face to deflect it to the right of the keeper. Stunning shot
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, pushed towards midwicket with a straight bat
full on leg stump, whipped away through square leg

ooh, well bowled, and a huge appeal, but the umpire isn't interested. Length ball, knuckleball, nips back in to beat Root's attempted drive down to long-on, and hits front pad. Clipping the outside of the top of leg stump, according to ball-tracking - can't complain about the decision
shortish on off stump, makes himself room to chop it through point

flat length ball on middle stump and Root attempts another reverse-ramp. Another appeal for lbw, and it isn't given again. It hit him on the back thigh, in front of middle stump, so unless there was some glove on it - nothing, according to Snicko - that looked plumb. Except ball-tracking says it was bouncing over the stumps
back of a length, punched to sweeper cover
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
shot! That was hardly short, but he jumped deep in his crease to pull to the left of deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, worked away through midwicket
shortish outside off, pulled to deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, gets behind it to defend towards short midwicket
back of a length close to off stump. Lets it come on and guides it to third man
wham. Down the track comes Root, and he brings up fifty with a flat-bat swat over mid-on for six. Southee served up a length ball outside off, giving him plenty of hitting room
shortish outside off, a bit of gentle away-curl, beats Root's attempt to dab that to third man
back of a length outside off, punched away through point
flat length ball outside off, check-driven to sweeper cover
flat, angling towards leg stump, gets down quickly to sweep to the right of deep square leg
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to deep square leg

slides down leg again, a little shorter than on the previous occasion, and Bairstow is down on one knee in a flash to pull-sweep to the left of short fine leg and bring up a superb hundred. With so much time left, how far can he extend his score?
back of a length on middle and leg, defended into the on side
short ball on off stump, rising to shoulder height, rolls his wrists over and keeps his pull down towards deep square leg
full-toss on off stump, around thigh-high, punched to mid-off
shortish outside off, cut away to third man
length ball close to off stump. Looks for the soft-hands single into the off side but hits it too close to backward point

full on off and middle, flicked away to the left of short fine leg. The placement allows them to pick up three while Munro sprints to his right from deep square leg and makes a sliding save at the boundary
is there a bottom edge on this one? Skids through from a shortish length close to off stump, and sneaks under Bairstow's pull. Flicks the pocket of his trousers on the way through

short on middle and off, pulled to the left of deep square leg and they risk a chancy second run. The throw from Nicholls is poor, though, not particularly powerful or accurate and forcing Latham away from the stumps. That allows Root to get back in time
shot! very full and wide of off, and he gets down on one knee, opens his bat face, and steers that to the right of backward point
short outside off, stabbed to sweeper cover
short outside off, slapped through point
tossed up outside off, and he's quickly in position for the slog-sweep. Hits against the turn, but hits it well, and into the gap at deep midwicket
short now, on leg stump, and he rocks back and plays a cross between a flick and a pull, finds the gap between short fine leg and deep backward square leg
short of a length and into the pads. Swivels and whips this towards Sodhi at short fine...and that sneaks through from under him
offcutter, good length and just outside off. Dabs it to third man with an open face
short ball outside off, pulls aerially to get it between deep square leg and midwicket. That's 150 between these two
another miscued pull. Or so it appears. He's got enough on it to just clear the midwicket boundary. No one deep there. Got it high on the bat
shapes for the ramp, watches it land short and quickly re-calibrates to guide it to third man
length on middle stump, jabbed with soft hands through midwicket and they come back for the second
tossed up at off stump, driven straight to mid-off
length on middle stump, steps out and chips to long-on
clears long-off. It's getting more and more brutal. Backs away, picks this length ball on off stump and launches a golf shot
the bails have fallen as Bairstow backs away and plays the late cut to point. It's from Latham's connection on the stumps though
length outside off, gets on one knee and looks to sweep. Cops it on the back thigh
length on middle stump, punched to long-on
short of a length and in at middle stump. Taps feebly into the covers. A closed ring on the off side at the moment
backs away to open up the off side. Gets followed with a yorker and he can only jam this back to the bowler
buh bye. Drops it short. The attempted knuckle ball. Sits up nicely, Bairstow clubs it with no fuss to clear midwicket
low full toss on leg stump, miscues the attempted slog. Gets it to long-on on the bounce
short ball on leg stump, swivels and pulls to deep square
umpire's dducking to get out of the way as Bairstow bludgeons this full toss straight past the bowler. Actually, he hasn't quite hit it right, but he's got enough. Bisects long-off and long-on
short of a length just outside off. Stabbed into the covers off the under-edge

on the roof over long-on and it bounces outside. I reckon there'll be a new ball from this end. Bairstow backs away and by this point he's become immune to the knuckle ball. He swings the old-fashioned slog and the official distance on that is 113 metres
backs away again and chops it late. Gives short third man a sliver of hope, but he beats him comfortably

taken at short third man. Bairstow walks off with some pride, acknowledging the crowd at ever corner. It's been a top innings, despite the ugly end. An offcutter from Munro, full on off stump. He's looking to go over midwicket but gets a top edge
back of a length on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
length on the pads, nudged straight to short fine leg
biffs this cover drive, but Guptill's a brave man to get his hands to this at extra cover. Sodhi tosses it up nice and wide first ball

taken! Sodhi's got a wicket off the second ball of his spell again. Drops it short of a length just outside off. It sticks in the pitch as it turns away and Buttler's attempted back foot punch is a a weak chip in the end. So weak that Sodhi requires a forward lunge to get to it. He does well
full on leg stump, flicked back at the bowler who lets it through moments after taking a sharp one
good length outside off, leans in and drives on the up to sweeper cover
struck on the back leg as he goes on the back foot. Rod Tucker turns down the appeal immediately. That spun past the inside edge and was probably missing leg. Morgan looking to defend that one
googly. Not picked. Stabs at it to try and get it through cover. It's an under-edge into the pitch
short of a length outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
chips over midwicket and it trickles away to deep square's right. It's full on leg stump and he leans in a long way before using his wrists to get this over
back of a length and in at leg stump. Poked into the off side

good catch running backwards by Munro. Morgan slices a short ball after stepping out at it. Gets too big on him as he brings out the pull. Munro pedals to his left from mid-on and keeps his eyes on it as he stretches to take this quite a way away from his body
short and into the ribs. Watches closely as he steers this hook to fine leg
overpitched and in at leg stump. Clipped off his toes to find mid-on
googly. Good length and spinning away from leg stump. Watchfully tapped back to the bowler

finds deep midwicket! It's 4 for 9 in under three overs! Sodhi loops one up at middle stump. Stokes gets under it on one knee but his slog sweep doesn't have too much power on it. It's a gentle lob for the fielder who barely has to move
short of a length and in at off stump. Pokes it to square leg off the back foot
short of a length outside off, chopped straight to point
beats him with a googly. Limited-overs cricket is Wristpsinner Central now. Ali doesn't pick this as he lunges outside off
length on middle stump, dabbed in front of midwicket with soft hands to steal the single
length and into the pads. Flicked straight to midwicket, on the up
good length and a hint of inswing towards off stump. Punches on the up to extra cover
good length on middle stump, pushed back down the pitch from the crease
inswinging yorker landing perfectly at middle stump. Jams it to extra cover

dropped but that shouldn't count, really. CDG nearly pulls off another screamer at midwicket. Ali slaps this short ball aerially to his right. He only has time to stick out his right hand, low to his right. Can't hold on
inswinging yorker at the toes. Nudged to midwicket's left.

googly, top edge, tumble, wicket! Five wickets for 13 runs. This is surreal. Ali looks to go over midwicket but he's assuming this one's coming into him. It's a loopy full ball on leg stump and it goes high. Southee runs in from long-off and gets low to snap it up. Keeps his balance as he goes onto the floor
short of a length outside off, sliced to point's right on the up
length outside off, leans in and drives to sweeper cover
tossed up wide outside off, dragged to deep midwicket off the toe-end
googly on an off stump line. Plants the front leg across and pokes through midwicket
length outside off. Taps it to extra cover off the high end of the bat. Single stolen
offcutter, length outside off. Flicked into the leg side
knuckle ball. Length outside off, leans in and drives on the up to long-off
full on off stump, wrists whip in front of deep square who keeps them to one
back of a length on off stump. Tapped to point from the crease

chips to long-on! Someone in commentary screeches 'Crazy! Bizzare!' and he isn't wrong. A half-hearted lift on the up from Woakes, to long-on's left. A regulation length ball, hit with no real purpose. Unless the purpose was to get it further than 30 yards, in which case he's succeeded by quite a way. Boult sprints in and to his left to hold on. And then he brings out the smile
length on middle stump, tapped into the leg side
floated up on leg stump, nudged straight to midwicket on the front foot
tossed up outside off, reaches out to drive to long-off
tossed up outside off, swats across the line to deep midwicket's left
tossed up outside off, neatly driven to sweeper cover
short of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
googly pitches on leg stump and goes further down. Rashid misses the flick
floated up on off stump, driven with the turn to sweeper cover
swish and miss. Drifts away from Rashid outside off and past his attempted cover drive
back of a length outside off, steered wide of point with an open face
good length outside off stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
length on middle stump, punched on the up to long-on
length on middle stump, flicked to fine leg's left with a flourish
back of a length just outside off, guided to third man with an angled bat
short ball slanted across off stump, a controlled hook to deep midwicket
short of a length outside off. Hangs the bat out and gets it to third man. England have 300
overpitched and wide outside off. Leans in to drive to sweeper's left
inside edge out to fine leg. Rashid looks to crash this length ball through the covers but he's come in an hour too late for that to work out...
he pokes it through midwicket and nearly gets run out as he comes back for the second. But he's safe. He kept England ticking, now he's keeping them alive. An ODI century for Root.
full and wide outside off. A nice-looking slice over point, but third man slides to his right to cut it off

'yesss,' says Latham as he takes this down leg side. The umpire raises his finger. Root appears to have gloved this hook shot. Bouncer doesn't come on as quickly as he expects it to. He's inside the line and playing away from his body by the time it arrives
short of a length on off stump, mistimed punch on the up. Lands in front of Southee

short ball outside off is hammered on the up to sweeper's right. It looks like it'll be the first boundary in eight overs. But Boult has a point to prove today. Sprins some 20 metres and dives one-handed to keep it in
short of a length outside off, mistimed punch to mid-off
shot. Nicely done by Rashid. Bouncer at an off stump line. Might have been of the slower variety. He's under it and he puts the bat up to lift it over the keeper
full and headed down leg. Rashid looks to flick and gets a deflection off the pad. Latham flies to his left and saves three
who needs fielders. Boult goes for the base of off stump and he damages it. Rashid looking to nudge this through cover but he's playing inside the line
yorker wide outside off, goes with his hands and gets this out to third man
another yorker. This one headed for leg stump. He backs away and gets a thick outside edge to third man as he looks to go over mid-off
yorker just outside off, squeezed straight to backward point
yorker just outside off stump, jammed to mid-off
yorker on off stump. Met on the full and carved behind square on the off side. Sweeper cleans up to his left
yorker in the channel outside off. Backs away and chops at it. Beaten. That was tailing in but not enough to hit off stump

shot! Anticipates the line and length, hops into the off side and uses the angle to scoop this to the fine leg boundary. Superbly executed, he was nearly outside the pitch on the off side as he got under this
superb hit again. Dances around in the crease a shade before standing tall. Southee gives him a knee-high full toss on middle stump and he pumps this straight over the bowler
lovely. Curran is giving England some momentum. Exposes the stumps, gets another full toss at knee height and he slices it to the backward point boundary

wow. What an innings this is. Anticipates the slower ball, stays put in the crease and launches this over mid-off. It's an offcutter on a good length at off stump. He does so well to lift this, because he's on the back foot

Nicholls does superbly to his right at deep square to save two runs. Leaps full length to stop this pull shot on the bounce. Curran was backing away, Southee followed him and he nailed this pull. Came back for the second to complete this and was safe on the run out review
back of a length close to off stump, punched to mid-off
length ball on off stump, defended solidly back down the pitch

back of a length close to off stump, and there's all sorts of confusion after Guptill plays late, with soft hands, into the point region. Roy charged in from backward point, and as he did so Guptill and Munro did a whole lot of yesnoyesno, but no one went too far out of his crease for any real alarms
back of a length on off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length again, on a tight off-stump line, punched to cover point
once again, that perfect top-of-off-stump line and length, angling in from slightly wider on the crease this time, and Guptill blocks it back to the bowler. Woakes begins with a maiden

perfect start from Wood, the perfect delivery to a left-hander from over the wicket. Full, with late swing to straighten the ball into the stumps. Munro plays all around it, looking to flick with his head falling over. No bat, straight onto front pad, and it's given. Munro's reviewed, however... Definitely no bat on it. It's pitching on middle stump, and it's hitting middle stump. I really don't see why Munro reviewed that unless he perceived some sort of non-existent inside edge
back of a length on off stump, and Williamson begins in typically Williamsonesque manner, jumping back and across and tucking it away through square leg
back of a length, fourth-stump line, defended towards mid-off
back of a length on off stump, gets right behind it to defend towards mid-on
back of a length close to off stump, gets on his toes and defends towards cover point
back of a length, a bit wider this time, punched firmly to cover
ouch. Back of a length again, and this time some inward movement and extra bounce. Guptill misses the flick, and the ball smacks him on the inside of his left thigh
length ball close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length again - he's been utterly metronomic so far - and very close to off stump. Guptill defends nice and late, and the ball bounces behind the wicket, towards slip

all the pressure of all those dots, and Guptill has succumbed. Woakes deserves this, but you have to wonder if Guptill went too hard too early. Looks to make a bit of room and hit over mid-off, but the length isn't full enough for that. Hits high on the bat and balloons up for mid-off to move a few steps to his left and catch it
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length once more, fifth-stump line, punched into the covers. He's consistently hitting the high part of the bat as well, I should add
length ball close to off stump, gets on the front foot to defend towards mid-off
length ball angling into off stump, defended to mid-on
full now, angling into middle stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length outside off, shuffles forward to push into the covers
length ball close to off stump, driven to mid-off

looks risky, but pretty routine for Taylor. Length ball angling into off and middle, and Taylor gets forward and - playing around his front pad - works it away to long leg. Don't try this at home, folks
back of a length outside off, a bit of extra bounce. Drops his bottom hand and plays late, runs it down to third man for another single
length ball angling into off stump, defended back towards the bowler
back of a length on off stump, rises on his toes to defend into the covers
shortish, fifth-stump line. Williamson looks to jump back and across and work it into the leg side, but has to adjust for the bounce Woakes generates, and plays it back to the bowler instead

ooh, nearly plays on. Back of a length again, in that fourth-stump zone, and Williamson is half-forward, looking to play his favourite chop down to third man. Ends up inside-edging it past his leg stump
back of a length outside off, jumps and brings his wrists into play to work that to the right of mid-on
length ball on off stump, punched to mid-on
fullish on off stump, and Williamson puts it away sweetly, brings down a perfectly straight bat and just eases it between the non-striker and the umpire, and mid-on has no chance chasing back
back of a length outside off, presses forward and lets it come on to guide it down to third man
length ball outside off, Taylor looks for the flat-bat drive through cover but doesn't really have the room he needs, ends up checking his shot. Rolls slowly to cover point
jumps wide of the crease this time and angles one into Taylor's pads. Tucked away to long leg
length ball, fifth-stump line, defended into the covers
shot! Beautifully timed, this. A pretty good length, but it swings away early and provides a bit of width, and Taylor gets on the front foot and strokes it on the up to the left of cover
length ball angling into off stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball, swings late and straightens towards off stump. Shows the full face and defends back down the pitch
length ball on off stump, punched to mid-on
not particularly short or wide, but you don't need to be either to provoke Taylor into cutting. Times it crisply to the right of third man
back of a length on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
short, angling into leg stump, pulled to the left of long leg
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across and whips to mid-on
short and wide, and Williamson puts it away easily. Flays it away to the left of the diving short point fielder

length ball outside off, presses forward and drives to short cover, who throws at Taylor's end and concedes an overthrow. Taylor was out of his crease, but would probably have made it back had the throw hit the stumps
back of a length on off stump, defended right under his eyes and the ball rolls away behind square, towards backward point
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and dabs to the left of backward point
fullish on off stump, driven to mid-on
back of a length outside off, and that's an outstanding shot. A straight-bat punch, just opens his bat face to bisect short point and backward point
back of a length on off stump, clipped to mid-on
ooh. Back of a length, just a bit of width, slapped away crisply but this time straight to Roy at backward point. He fumbles to allow the single
length ball angling towards leg stump or down leg. Taylor looks to flick, misses, and the ball rolls off the outside half of his pad into the leg side
back of a length close to off stump, stands tall and punches towards cover point
back of a length on off stump, defended towards midwicket
short, rises to chest height while angling into Taylor's body. His weight is on the front foot but he manages to bring that bottom wrist into play and pull it away over the long leg boundary. Wow
and again, superb shot. Length ball angling into middle stump, and he brings those wrists into play to whip it to the left of short fine leg
back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
length ball close to off stump, defended into the off side
length ball outside off, presses forward and defends, letting ball hit bat rather than the other way around, and they steal a single as the ball drops gently into the backward point region
starts with a short googly, and Williamson pulls to deep midwicket
short on off stump, and Taylor makes himself just a bit of room and cuts it away fiercely to the right of backward point
nicely flighted length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
floated up slow outside leg, ends up as a low full-toss that Taylor sweeps to long leg
another short googly, pulled to deep midwicket
short, a bit of width, slapped to sweeper cover
starts by drifting onto Taylor's pads, and that's a no-go zone. Flicked away into the big gap to the left of long leg
length ball on off stump, pushes forward and clips to mid-on
length ball on off stump, clipped to midwicket
shuffles a couple of steps down the pitch and across to the off side. Curran reacts by bowling a shortish ball outside off, and he dabs gently into the point region to pick up one

for the second time in this innings, Williamson nearly chops on. Wanted to dab the ball to third man like he often does, and the ball nipped back in a touch to take the inside edge, before rolling onto his back leg
a bit wider outside off this time, and he safely chops it down to third man

down the track and Rashid's drift and lack of turn confound him. Wants to clip into the midwicket region, but in the end the ball beats his inside edge and hits his front pad - a feeble lbw appeal, but that struck his pad outside leg stump
a bit of flight outside off, driven into the covers
down the track again, clips it off middle and leg through square leg

this was coming sooner or later. Out of his crease again, and this time Rashid dangles one wider outside off. Not quite to the pitch of it, and he's hitting against the turn, but he just swings freely through the line and clears the long-on boundary
back of a length on middle and leg, punched down to mid-on
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length on off stump, jumps back and across to work it through square leg
back of a length, a bit of inward nip towards middle stump. Tucked away to deep square leg
shortish outside off, punched to deep point
slower ball, back of a length, angling into Taylor's hip. Tucks it away towards fine leg
fullish, offers width, driven crisply to the right of Bairstow at deep point. Sprints quickly to his right and makes a good diving stop
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and steers it to third man
back of a length on leg stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
nicely flighted length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
a touch shorter, on middle stump, goes back and works it into the midwicket region

short outside off, and that's a great stop from Stokes at straight midwicket. A fiercely struck pull from Williamson, and he's moving in the wrong direction - to his right - before somehow changing direction and stopping it one-handed with a dive to his left
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short and very wide, and Taylor slaps it away to the point boundary

full outside off, and Williamson leans forward and drives deliberately in the air, over the leaping man at short extra-cover and slightly to his left, and picks up two by the time the sweeper can run around to his right to cut it off
short outside off, and the airborne Williamson meets it at the top of its bounce with an open face to guide it down to third man
short slower ball outside off. Taylor is through his pull too quickly and can't connect
shortish outside off, chopped to the right of third man
shortish on off stump, gets on his toes to punch to deep point
back of a length close to off stump. Looks to run it down to third man but ends up playing it squarer than he'd like, straight towards backward point

short, angling down leg, and that's not how England would have thought they'd get Williamson, but it is what it is. Looks to pull, they go up in appeal for a gloved caught behind, and it's given out. Williamson doesn't look happy - did he not get a touch on it? In any case, thanks to Munro's wasted review, there's nothing he can do about it
short of a length on leg stump, dabbed into the square leg region with soft hands
short of a length and in at leg stump. Glanced to deep square
short and outside off. Looks to hook and is late on it. Gets it to midwicket off the under-edge
short of a length outside off, tapped to sweeper cover with the angle
length on the pads, dabbed to deep square leg
bouncer at off stump. Taylor late as he looks to hook. This flies through to the keeper
short ball at the hips and he swats it powerfully, right off the middle of the bat. Beats deep square to his left
short and just outside off, steered to third man
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length and in at middle stump. Pushed to mid-on
good length and just outside off. Defended on the front foot
nicely timed back foot slice, but he can't beat point who dives to his right. This was slanted across the off stump
back of a length at off stump. Dead-batted into the pitch

England have reviewed for lbw. This is a very full ball that strikes Latham in front of leg stump. He appears to have shuffled and showed leg stump as he misses the flick. This prompts England to take the review...the first look at the replay suggests no evidence of bat. More importantly, it appears the ball wasn't as full as first perceived and therefore is probably pitching outside leg...yes.Pitching outside leg. Review lost.
length ball jumps up at Taylor as he looks to defend outside off stump
length on leg stump, jabbed into the square leg region
length and slanted across off stump. Sliced to third man on the up
dropped! Oh Moeen's put down a simple chance. Tossed up full on off stump. Latham looks to drive to long-on and ends up slicing it right back to the bowler, slow and weak. He grabs and grasses.
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full on middle stump, defended on the front foot
carts it over deep midwicket. Good connection on this after springing onto the back foot and picking it up from middle stump. Moeen dropped it short
good length on middle stump, deep in the crease to clip this to deep square. That's his fifty
length ball outside off, pushed with the angle to third man
length and in at leg stump. Nudged through square leg
overpitched outside off, a nicely balanced drive to mid-off's right
good length outside off, opens the face and steers to third man
overpitched outside off, square drive on the bounce, straight to point
full outside off, big stride forward to drive to long-on
tossed up on off stump. Steps out, meets it on the full and drives to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, pushed to point off the thick outside edge
back of a length at off stump, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
back of a length slider just outside off, punched to sweeper cover
good length outside off, picks it with the turn for a single to deep square
back of a length at middle stump. Poked to midwicket from the crease
top edge on the hook. Lands safely in front of deep square. Late on it as he tries to drag from well outside off
length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
offcutter, good length on off stump. Defended to point on the front foot
length on off stump, tapped to mid-off on the up
length on leg stump, clipped to deep square on the up
length outside off, dead-batted into the pitch
length and coming in at off stump. Looks to flick and is caught on the pad. Appeal turned down. Looked to be high, for starters...
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
full on middle stump, drives towards long-on, can't beat midwicket's dive to the left
full on off stump, driven straight to extra cover
length on middle stump, flicked through square on the front foot
good length and just outside off. Defended from the crease
offcutter, full outside off. Gets Taylor to drive hard and it's a mistimed one. Stokes parries it wide of extra cover and after some hesitation, Taylor calls through for the run
sort of a length outside off, tapped to sweeper cover on the up
short ball in the corridor. Controlled pull to deep square
short and wide outside off, reaches out for the cut and gets it to sweeper's left. Well to his left. But Bairstow gets across quickly
length and angled across off stump. Closes the face on it and gets a leading edge to third man
tossed up outside off, swept to deep square leg
length outside off, driven to long-on with the turn
length on middle stump, sliding in. Tucks it off the knees to deep midwicket
good length outside off. Defended on the front foot
Ali has the ball and the bat as he fields this. Tossed up at middle stump, flicked towards long-on. He flies to his right, one-handed, and knocks Latham over
full outside off, reaches out to flick, cops it on the pad
full outside off, drags it to short fine with a sweep off the toe-end
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked through midwicket
floated up at a length, wide outside off. Driven on the up to long-off
full on leg stump. Goes against the turn, with the reverse sweep. Can't get bat on it, only pad
tossed up outside off. Steps out and jams it into the pitch. Just gets it over the bowler to long-on
full and speared in at off stump. Looks to play the reverse-paddle and just manages to get the back of the bat on this. Onto boot and then it rolls out to short third man
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
nicely done. Full ball outside off and like Latham, he goes for the reverse-ramp. Gets it right off the back of the bat, on the full, and finds the boundary
conventional sweep and it's over deep backward square. He isn't to the pitch of this but swats it over the fielder
length on middle stump, clipped to deep square
length on off stump, steps out and turns it towards mid-on with soft hands
length outside off stump. Picks the googly and goes full force with the reverse sweep. Gets it to deep cover's right
googly again. Negated by getting to the pitch and sweeping from over it. Gets it out to deep square
short and spinning wide outside off. Cut to sweeper cover
short of a length at middle stump, pushed through midwicket off the back foot
length on middle, down on one knee again for the sweep. Gets it to deep square's right and a fumble allows the easy second
length on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket after a hop down the pitch

inside edge trickles past short fine. Moeen nearly does him. Fires it in, full at leg stump. Expects the sweep to come out and it does. Completely cramped but it rolls between his legs and wide of the fielder

fired in full again. Steps out and misses as he looks to flick. Loud appeal for lbw is turned down. That struck him in front of leg stump...and it was hitting according to tracker. He was well down though, can't blame the umpire
tucks this through square leg from a length on middle
beaten as he looks to play the reverse sweep. This lifts off a length outside off
length and in at leg stump. Steps out and flicks to deep midwicket
back of a length and in at leg stump. Nudged through square leg
short and just outside off. Cut straight to backward point
full on off stump, driven firmly to extra cover who fumbles and allows a run
back of a length on leg stump. Steps out and taps to deep midwicket
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
dropped short at a middle stump line and he pounces with a pull. Gets it to deep midwicket's right but once again, Bairstow cannot be breached
full on leg stump, flicked between deep midwicket and deep square with soft hands
length outside off, flicked to short fine with the turn
short and skidding low at leg stump. Flicked to deep square
length outside off. Sweeps on the rise to deep midwicket's left. Bairstow slides and relays to deep square. They pick up two in the meantime
good length on middle stump, clips to deep midwicket
good length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper's right
full on leg stump. Jammed through midwicket off the toe-end of the bat. Enough non-pace on it to steal a second
front-of-the-hand slider on a length, fired in at off stump. Pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
back of a length on leg stump, glanced to deep midwicket off the back foot

superb delivery to beat him in flight. He's about three yards down the pitch as he misses on the flick. It clips the front leg but the lbw appeal is turned down. Buttler can't gather as this flies over his head
beaten as he looks to sweep. This climbs up from a good length outside off

dropped by Bairstow at deep midwicket. Taylor pulls across the turn and gets it to his right. It looks like Bairstow has misjudged this because he's gone one-handed to his right and jumped early. Gets it into the turf and it rolls into the boundary padding
top edge lands to third man's left. Goes for the ugly heave on the front foot
oh what a shot. What a shot. Full outside off and he leans in before drilling this cover drive to sweeper's right. Gave him no chance
length and turning in at leg stump. Can't get bat on the flick and cops it on the pad
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length on off stump, swept straight to deep square
once more through extra cover! This time it's hit so hard, it bursts through the fielder's effort there. Another full ball wide outside off and he gets all his power behind this
floated up full on leg stump, clipped into the midwicket region
another of those loopy near-yorkers, on off stump. Jabbed back towards the bowler - he was looking to play it more in the direction of cover

there it is! Gets to the century in typical fashion, stepping deep into his crease to cut one that isn't particularly short or wide, and picks up two by the time the sweeper runs around to his left to cut it off
cuts again, this time hits it straight to backward point
flat and fullish on middle stump, punched back to the bowler

makes room and looks to cut an off-stump ball, doesn't get as much power on it as he'd like. Chops it down hard into the ground, and it slows down enough for backward point to move to his right and cut off the single
length ball outside off, steered with an open face to the right of sweeper cover
short, a bit of width, and Taylor slaps it away hard, to the left of the diving point fielder. Poor ball from Wood
and again, not as much width this time, plays a more controlled cut to the right of third man, and slips at the non-striker's end, so he can't come back for the second

sees the batsman trying to make room and follows him with a shortish ball at his body. Ends up bottom-edging his attempted cut by his feet, and Taylor is alert to the possibility of a single at the other end
shortish, not too much width, chopped away to third man. Wood went wide of the crease to create the angle into Taylor

shot! That's shortish, angling into Latham's hip, and he just flicks it over the square leg boundary, timing it sensationally, and brings up another excellent half-century. His job is by no means done, however
slower ball, back of a length outside off. Waits an age for it to come on and steers it down to third man
short, angling across the left-hander, and he pulls this time, from outside off stump, extends his arms fully and easily clears the midwicket boundary. Sixes off successive balls for him
back of a length on off stump, punched to the right of extra-cover

length ball outside off and Taylor plays a fierce front-foot cut that bursts past the diving backward point fielder's hands. They chance a second and complete it, but it forces Taylor to dive to regain his ground, and he looks in a bit of trouble. He had injured himself doing the same thing a couple of matches ago...
shortish outside off, chopped down to third man. Taylor doesn't look all too comfortable running to the other end
length ball close to off stump, defended to extra-cover
short, angling into the body, looks to pull and gets a bottom-edge down to long leg
back of a length, tucks Latham up with his angle from wide of the crease, and he can't do much other than defend back down the pitch
full-toss on off stump, clipped away through midwicket
jumps wide of the crease and angles a short one into Taylor's body, gets it to bounce around chest-high. Pulled to deep square leg. Limps the second half of the single
length ball outside off, punched to the man at point

fullish, angling into Latham's pads, and he loves it there. Flicks it in the air, deliberately, over mid-on. Root chases back and tries to pull it back with a desperate dive, but he can't quite manage it
back of a length on off stump, tucked away through square leg
short, slanting away from off stump and offering some width, slashed away in the air, just wide of Roy diving to his left from backward point
shortish on off stump, pulled hard towards long-on, who comes in off the rope to stop it. They don't take the single - which is bad news as far as the injury is concerned
bam. He can't run, but he can smash 'em alright. Short again, angling in towards off stump, and he swats it away high over the midwicket boundary
slower ball, ends up misdirecting it completely and whanging it waaay down the leg side
back of a length outside off. Taylor goes for the big hoick over the leg side, ends up top-edging it fine to the third man boundary

slower ball, back of a length on off stump. Drops it gently into the off side and takes off for the single. Stokes fields in his follow-through, turns, and throws, but misses the stumps at the non-striker's end. He would probably have been in even if the throw had hit the stumps
Sees him shaping to make room and fires in a full one wide of off stump. Can't connect despite shuffling across in response
bouncer outside off, and Taylor's found the gap adroitly. Just uses the pace to ramp it, and beats third man to his right. One bounce and over the rope
tries to fire in that wide yorker again, and this time it's well wide of the tramline outside off

full again, not quite a yorker, and a lot closer to off stump. Taylor clears his front leg, aims for a flat-bat hit over cover, and ends up top-edging to the third man boundary again, just past the right glove of the keeper. They all count...
this is poor bowling. The one place you really mustn't bowl to Taylor. Short and wide, and he unleashes another slap to the right of backward point
full this time, outside off, slapped away to the right of deep point
back of a length, angling into off and middle. Tucked away to deep square leg
down the track to the floated-up off-stump ball, whipped away to deep midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, clipped down to long-on
down the track again, gets right to the pitch of this off-stump ball, and clips into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on. The latter fielder stops it with a slide
tossed up on middle and off, and Taylor's bottom hand has sent this out of Dunedin. Waaay over wide long-on
tosses it up slower and much wider, and he fetches a sweep from outside off to deep midwicket, without quite getting down on his back knee
floated across the left-hander towards off stump, and he plays a perfect reverse-sweep, except he hits it straight to short third man
and for the second ball in a row, a nicely executed shot goes straight to a fielder. Short fine leg this time, after Taylor leans forward and across to lap-sweep a full one outside off
shortish on off stump, pulled to deep square leg
length ball on middle and leg, clipped down to long-on

oh man, that's a candidate for shot of the innings. Brings up 150 as well. A near-yorker, on a fourth-stump line, and he brings those hands and wrists into play to squeeze that to the right of backward point and render sweeper cover's dive useless - even though he got his hand to the ball
shortish on off stump, pulled to deep square leg

full on off stump, and Curran has broken the partnership. Slower ball, and Latham loses his shape while trying to go over mid-off. Got too much undeneath the ball, and ended up slicing it high in the air to backward point
shortish, close to off stump, cut hard but straight to backward point
tossed up slow, wide of off, swept along the ground to wide long-on
wow. That's a pretty good way to start. Gets one in the slot, loopy and on leg stump, and he clears his front leg and hits it hard, to the left of long-on, with a nice, straight bat
dangles this wide of off stump now, and CDG launches it into the gap to the right of sweeper cover
flatter now, wide of off stump again, driven to the right of sweeper cover
full outside off, driven to the right of sweeper cover, far enough to his right to pick up two, even with his dodgy quadriceps
digs it in short outside off, and de Grandhomme has ramped this for six! Stunning shot, middles it perfectly, and simply lifts it into the gap to the left of third man
slower ball, and de Grandhomme doesn't pick it. His head falls over as he goes into his flick too early, thick inside edge into pad

another slower ball, and this time de Grandhomme spots it, holds his shape, and simply flicks it for six. Back of the hand, but it is of no avail, as it goes soaring into the grassy banks beyond deep square leg
slower ball again, short, outside off, plays a nice, controlled pull out to deep backward square leg
shortish outside off, lets it come on and dabs to third man
yorker, right at the base of off stump. Digs it out into the off side, thinks of one, but the bowler moves swiftly in his follow-through to deny him
wide yorker, nails the line if not quite the length, and Taylor, reaching out to slash, can't connect
low full-toss on off stump, clips it to long-on and hobbles to the other end
another yorker outside off, jabbed to the right of backward point
full outside off, not quite a yorker. Drives it hard, with a lot of bottom hand, straight to mid-off
shortish on off stump, pulled away through square leg
short, lots of width too, but he doesn't really move back and across. Just swishes hard at it from a standing start, and doesn't connect
low full-toss on off stump, punched hard to mid-off
fullish on off stump, whipped to long-on
low full-toss again, on off stump, jabbed hard but straight to extra-cover

wide full-toss, and de Grandhomme smashes it straight to backward point. He could have hit that anywhere, but he finds the man right on the edge of the 30-yard circle, at knee height. Dunedin goes silent. What a match this is
fullish outside off, driven to the left of sweeper cover
good yorker, provokes an lbw appeal as Taylor plays around it. Not given, and Taylor looks in a lot of pain. Has he smashed his bat into his own toe? Looks likee an inside-edge too
full, slanting away from off stump, driven to sweeper cover
wide-ish yorker, stabbed away to the left of the sweeper. Could have taken two had his legs permitted it
in the blockhole on leg stump, clipped to the left of midwicket

that's yuuuuge! He's been landing his yorker there or thereabouts for two overs now, but this one's underpitched, and it's a half-volley just outside off stump. Taylor swings freely through it and sends it flying over long-on and out of the ground
lovely hands. Wide yorker, squeezed away to the right of third man, forcing him into a desperate dive, and they somehow scamper two as well
again he misses the yorker, and sends down a wide half-volley. Taylor flat-bats it to the cover boundary, and it's down to under a run a ball again. He's moved into the 170s too
slower ball, back of a length on middle stump, tucked away through square leg
slower ball on the pads, clipped away to the left of short fine leg. Deep backward square leg runs around to stop it
skiddy short ball on off stump and Nicholls doesn't time the pull right. Bottom-edges into the pitch, down by his feet
and again, misses the pull. This one's a slower short ball, and it hits top edge, left shoulder, and then rolls down to third man
back of a length on middle and off. Makes a bit of room and dabs it down to third man
yorker outside off, jabbed to extra-cover
full-toss on off stump, stump-high, and he opens up at the hips and just swats it away over the midwicket boundary. The bat speed was just astonishing
length ball on off stump, makes a bit of room and carves it to deep point
length ball wide of off, flat-batted to sweeper cover
short outside off. He'd usually cut this, but he's thinking six now, and he goes for the big pull and misses
in the blockhole close to off stump, flat-batted hard to mid-off and he hobbles through for one
full, flicked off his legs to deep square leg, and he retains the strike

swings across the line at a full one, misses, there's a huge lbw appeal, that's not given (pitched outside leg, I think), he scrambles out of his crease, he's sent back, he slips. The throw from backward point misses the stumps. Everything is happening, and Henry Nicholls is the bundle of nerves in the middle of it all
full outside off, and he drives it hard, along the ground, and straight to mid-off. Oh man.

full, on the pads, and Nicholls finishes with a six! He's done it! A flick, and it sails flat over the square leg boundary. What a hit. It was in his slot, but he had to put all the nerves of the last few balls out of his mind. He does it, and there's barely a smile on his face at the end of it as Taylor hobbles across to hug him
